value.title: Apple joins lawsuit regarding Trump-era tariffs on Chinese products
value.excerpt: Apple, Intel and Pfizer have joined 3,700 other U.S. businesses in their suit against the U.S. regarding Trump-era tariffs on $300 billion worth of Chinese products, reports Jurist. This lawsuit was first brought by HMTX Industries in September 2020 and initially targeted List 3 tariffs.

value.title: Charles Barkley Blasts Crowd 'Stupidity' For Booing Donald Trump Over Vaccines
value.excerpt: The NBA legend is headlining an event in Alabama on Saturday to encourage people to take the COVID-19 vaccine.

value.title: A top Pennsylvania Republican reboots 'audit' of 2020 vote, removes Trump ally as chair
value.excerpt: A dispute spilled into public view late last week as some Pennsylvania Republicans seek to further investigate the November election.

value.title: Supreme Court rules in favor of Trump’s ‘remain in Mexico’ policy
value.excerpt: The court, with three liberal justices dissenting, rejected the Biden administration’s effort to block a Texas-based judge’s ruling requiring the government to revive Trump’s

value.title: Trump claims Biden's Afghanistan evacuation could be bringing 'terrorists' to America
value.excerpt: In an August 25 statement, Trump asked people to imagine "how many terrorists" were "airlifted out of Afghanistan" and into neighborhoods worldwide.

value.title: Jack Nicklaus on his Donald Trump endorsement, Tiger’s future — and a pickleball injury
value.excerpt: Legendary golfer, whose travels have been limited by the pandemic, expounds on recent topics at a charity stop in Virginia.

value.title: Column: Donald Trump can’t cram his ‘fake news’ genie back in his bottle
value.excerpt: As Donald Trump may be discovering, once you’ve let that “fake news” genie out of the bottle, it’s impossible to reverse all of the damage it can bring.

value.title: Former Trump adviser: Biden needs to fire top Taliban negotiator Khalilzad
value.excerpt: Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster, Donald Trump’s former national security adviser, is laying some of the blame for the current chaos in Afghanistan squarely at the feet of Ambassador Zalmay Khalilzad, the Afghan-American diplomat who has been the point man for talks with the Taliban in both Republican and Democratic administrations.

value.title: Lightning-rod Trump supporter Scott Presler's rally canceled in Wilton
value.excerpt: Scott Presler, a political operative identified as a former top strategist for an anti-Muslim group, canceled an appearance Wednesday at Gavin Park that was touted by U.S. Rep. Elise Stefanik and the local Republican Party.

value.title: Trump calls on Florida judge to help reinstate his Youtube account
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump on Monday asked a Florida judge to issue a preliminary injunction in his case against YouTube that would compel the company to reinstate his access to the platform.

value.title: Hostile Trump mob sends GOP Rep. Brooks into panicked backpedal on moving on from 2020
value.excerpt: Rachel Maddow shares video of Republican Congressman Mo Brooks being roundly booed by the audience at a Donald Trump rally in Alabama after Brooks suggested they move on from Trump's 2020 loss and focus on future elections.

value.title: Craig says he wants 'to be defined as James Craig, not Donald Trump'
value.excerpt: Former Detroit Police Chief James Craig, who is exploring a run for Michigan governor, says he would accept Donald Trump's endorsement if offered.

value.title: Former Pence Aide: Rhetoric Under Trump Admin About Afghans 'Hurtful' and 'Offensive'
value.excerpt: A former aide for former Vice President Mike Pence, Olivia Troye, is opening up about the rhetoric under the Trump administration about Afghans, calling it “hurtful” and “offensive.” CNN’s Brianna Keilar noted during “New Day” Monday Troye sat in on meetings about getting Afghans who are eligible for relief who helped U.

value.title: Matt Gaetz says he asked for Trump's approval before proposing to Ginger Luckey, who eloped with him amid a sex trafficking probe
value.excerpt: Matt Gaetz said he asked for former President Donald Trump's approval before proposing to his now-wife Ginger Luckey, with whom he eloped over the weekend amid a federal sex

value.title: Carlyle Alum’s Governor Run Mixes Trump Backing, MAGA-Lite Style
value.excerpt: The crowd of about 300 Republican stalwarts in Norfolk, Virginia, included those wearing the requisite red baseball caps.

value.title: Vos to keep Trump "updated" on election investigation
value.excerpt: Assembly Speaker Robin Vos the said in a statement Saturday he is going to be keeping Trump “updated on our investigation,” the Journal Times reported. value.title: Barron Trump Enrolls In $35,000-A-Year Private School In Florida
value.excerpt: Barron Trump has enrolled in an exclusive private school in Palm Beach, Florida, for the new school year. A spokesperson for Oxbridge Academy announced earlier this week that Melania and Donald Trump's 15-year-old son has enrolled in the elite school as part of the class of 2024,

value.title: With fight over mask mandates, Gov. Abbott passes purity test in Trump's GOP
value.excerpt: When Texas had its first big surge of COVID hospitalizations, Gov. Greg Abbott responded by shutting down bars and mandating masks. As the second surge hit, Abbott put in place an automatic trigger to restrict the operating capacities of businesses and halt non-emergency surgeries to free up hospital beds in areas with high hospitalizations.

value.title: TV tonight: Ruby Wax revisits her time with Donald Trump
value.excerpt: A nasty encounter with Donald Trump and much more in this entertaining new series. Plus: The Handmaid’s Tale ends. Here’s what to watch this evening

value.title: More than half of Kinzinger's GOP primary challengers believe Trump won the 2020 election
value.excerpt: Even though allegations of widespread fraud in the 2020 presidential election haven't been substantiated, four conservatives challenging Republican U.S. Rep. Adam Kinzinger for his congressional seat insist Donald Trump actually won reelection.

value.title: Former Pence aide says Trump and Miller stymied Afghan refugee efforts.
value.excerpt: Olivia Troye recalled sitting in meetings where Stephen Miller, Mr. Trump’s top immigration adviser, demanded restrictions on refugees, including those from Afghanistan and Iraq.

value.title: Donald Trump speaking in Alabama for the first time in 4 years
value.excerpt: Trump will speak tonight in Cullman, his first political event in Alabama since 2017. (AP Photo/Ross D. Franklin, File) AP Six years to the day after a rally in Mobile gave an early glimpse of Donald Trump’s ability to generate the excitement that would propel him to the White House,

value.title: Donald Trump endorses ex-Nevada AG Adam Laxalt for Senate
value.excerpt: The endorsement, released Friday night, comes days after former Nevada Attorney General Adam Laxalt officially announced his candidacy for U.S. Senate.

value.title: Alan Dershowitz Says Donald Trump Ties Have Lost Him Many Friends
value.excerpt: The lawyer made headlines this week after he was spotting in a war of words with famous comedian and writer Larry David.

value.title: How the Trump Tax Law Created a Loophole That Lets Top Executives Net Millions by Slashing Their Own Salaries
value.excerpt: The 2017 tax cuts made it more attractive for certain company owners to be paid in profits instead of wages. Some cut their own wages, expanding a loophole that was already costing the U.S. billions.

value.title: Trump Teases About Running For President In 2024: 'You're Gonna Be Very Happy'
value.excerpt: The former president claimed it would be illegal to confirm his plans for re-election, but added that "a lot of our friends" will be happy.

value.title: Trump family friend, associate Ken Kurson re-arrested on cyber-stalking charges
value.excerpt: Seven months after he was granted a pardon by then-President Trump, Ken Kurson, a friend of Trump's son-in-law, was arrested Wednesday on new charges.
